citation.article-title: Psychromonas heitensis sp. nov., a psychrotolerant bacterium isolated from seawater in Japan.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Psychromonas heitensis sp. nov.
Psychromonas heitensis (hei.ten′sis. N.L. fem. n. heitensis, pertaining to Heita bay, where the organisms were isolated).
Cells are Gram-negative, facultatively anaerobic, rod-shaped, approximately 1.0–1.5 μm long by 0.5–1.0 μm wide.
Cells are motile by means of single subpolar flagella.
Cytochrome oxidase- and catalase-positive.
Optimal growth temperature is 20–25 °C; growth occurs at 2 or 30 °C, but not at 37 °C.
pH range for growth is 6.0–9.0.
Growth occurs at NaCl concentrations of 3–4 %; no growth occurs in the absence of NaCl.
Positive for alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and α-glucosidase.
Positive for degradation of DNA, aesculin, starch and Tweens 20, 40, 60 and 80.
Does not reduce nitrate (API 20E).
Acid is produced by fermentation from glucose (API 20NE), and also by oxidation from glucose, fructose, mannitol, cellobiose, maltose, sucrose, trehalose and starch (API 50 CH).
Acid production from glycogen is variable.
Does not decompose tyrosine or urea.
Indole is not produced.

Negative for arginine dihydrolase, lipase (C4), cystine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, trypsin, chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetylglucosamidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase.

Does not produce acid from glycerol, erythritol, dl-arabinose, ribose, dl-xylose, adonitol, methyl β-d-xylopyranoside, d-galactose, d-mannose, sorbose, l-rhamnose, dulcitol, myo-inositol, methyl α-d-mannopyranoside, methyl α-d-glucopyranoside, N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, salicin, d-lactose, melibiose, inulin, melezitose, raffinose, xylitol, gentiobiose, turanose, d-lyxose, d-tagatose, dl-fucose, dl-arabitol, gluconate, 2-ketogluconate or 5-ketogluconate (API 50 CH).

Assimilation of the following carbon sources is positive for maltose, dl-malate and citrate, and negative for glucose, l-arabinose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, N-acetylglucosamine, gluconate, n-capric acid, adipic acid and phenylacetate (API 20NE).
Predominant fatty acids are 16 : 1ω7c and 16 : 0.
Major respiratory quinone is Q-8.
The DNA G+C content is 38 mol%.
The type strain, AK15-027T (=MBIC 06898T=NCIMB 14416T), was isolated from seawater taken from Heita Bay off Kamaishi in Japan.
Strains 04HE-4-40 (=MBIC 08331), A4I-9 (=MBIC 08332) and A4I-21 (=MBIC 08330) are additional reference strains.
